items.title: Dell’s ultra-thin 14 Plus Intel-powered Copilot+ PC with 32GB RAM/1TB SSD just hit $780 all-time low ($520 off)
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Dell’s Intel-powered 14 Plus Copilot+ PC down to $779.98 shipped. This particular variant with 32GB RAM and 1TB SSD typically goes for $1,300, so you’re looking at a $520 discount on it right now. Dell currently has the same config for $1,000, so you’re saving $520 by cashing in on Amazon’s offer today, which even beats Dell’s current price for the Ultra 7 256V variant of this laptop with 16GB RAM. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this laptop, and it’s now going for $20 less than its previous all-time low. Head below for more details.

items.title: This Anker 140W 4-port Prime charger with display can power all your devices, and it’s down to its lowest price today at $60
items.summary:
Alongside Anker’s 2026 Valentine’s Day sale, which is now live at the brand’s online store and matched at its Amazon storefront, Newegg is offering a notable deal on one of the chargers that is not discounted as part of the ongoing sale. Courtesy of the brand’s official storefront at Newegg, you can now score its 140W 4-port display-equipped Prime charger for $59.99 shipped. Don’t forget to enter promo code BGSF36 during checkout to see the discounted price. This is regularly a $100 unit, which is currently fetching its full price at Amazon. Anker has the Dark Gray variant for $89.99 shipped with a relatively lighter deal, but Newegg’s offer beats it with a straight-up $40 discount. This deal marks the return of the lowest price it first hit at Amazon earlier this year during the fall Prime Day sale, making this a great time to cash in.

items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Walmart that drops Lenovo’s Legion 5i RTX 5070-powered OLED gaming laptop down to $1,399 shipped. This Intel-powered notebook typically goes for $1,850, so you’re looking at a solid $451 discount on it right now. It would cost you $1,830 if you were to put together the same config for the Legion 5i directly at Lenovo’s online store, so Walmart’s offer delivers a great value for your money overall with over $450 in savings. We’ve seen the RTX 5060-powered variant go for less, but this is the first time we’re tracking this steep of a discount on this notebook with an RTX 5070 GPU. This laptop is packed with a ton of great features, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

items.title: Lawn lovers can grab either of these EGO 15-inch cordless electric string trimmer kits starting from $179 right now
items.summary:
Amazon is currently offering folks looking for off-season tool deals another chance to pick up the EGO Power+ 56V 15-inch POWERLOAD Cordless Electric String Trimmer with 2.5Ah battery at $199 shipped. It’s coming down from a $219 tag here, which we’ve been seeing repeat since early October’s Prime Day event. While it has gone lower in the past, like I said, this $20 markdown is the best recurring rate we have tracked since October, and knowing this particular brand, it could be a long time before it sees any larger discounts, making it a solid get for your upcoming spring needs right now. You can also save an extra $20 by going with this less-advanced EGO Rapid Reload string trimmer that also comes with a 2.5Ah battery at $179 shipped.

items.title: China is leading the fight against hidden car door handles
items.summary: Under new safety rules published Monday by China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, cars sold in the country must have mechanical releases on their door handles. The new rules, which go in effect January 1, 2027, will prohibit the hidden, electronically actuated door handles popularized by Tesla — and now found on numerous other electric vehicles in China.
